briefdescription.para: Creates a counting sempahore.

parameterdescription.para: The maximum count value that can be reached.
The initial count value assigned to the new semaphore.

simplesect.para: A newly created semaphore. If an error occurred, NULL will be returned and errno can be checked for hints as to why sem_create failed.

briefdescription.para: Deletes a semaphore (or binary semaphore)

parameterdescription.para: Semaphore to delete

briefdescription.para: Creates a binary semaphore.

simplesect.para: A newly created semaphore.

briefdescription.para: Waits for the semaphore's value to be greater than 0.

detaileddescription.para: If the value is already greater than 0, this function immediately returns.
See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/multitasking.html#semaphores for details.

parameterdescription.para: Semaphore to wait on
Time to wait before the semaphore's becomes available. A timeout of 0 can be used to poll the sempahore. TIMEOUT_MAX can be used to block indefinitely.

simplesect.para: True if the semaphore was successfully take, false otherwise. If false is returned, then errno is set with a hint about why the sempahore couldn't be taken.

briefdescription.para: Increments a semaphore's value.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/multitasking.html#semaphores for details.

parameterdescription.para: Semaphore to post

simplesect.para: True if the value was incremented, false otherwise. If false is returned, then errno is set with a hint about why the semaphore couldn't be taken.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current value of the semaphore.

parameterdescription.para: A semaphore handle

simplesect.para: The current value of the semaphore (e.g. the number of resources available)

briefdescription.para: Creates a queue.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/extended/multitasking.html#queues for details.

parameterdescription.para: The maximum number of items that the queue can contain.
The number of bytes each item in the queue will require.

simplesect.para: A handle to a newly created queue, or NULL if the queue cannot be created.

briefdescription.para: Posts an item to the front of a queue.

detaileddescription.para: The item is queued by copy, not by reference.
See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/extended/multitasking.html#queues for details.

parameterdescription.para: The queue handle
A pointer to the item that will be placed on the queue.
Time to wait for space to become available. A timeout of 0 can be used to attempt to post without blocking. TIMEOUT_MAX can be used to block indefinitely.

simplesect.para: True if the item was preprended, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Posts an item to the end of a queue.

detaileddescription.para: The item is queued by copy, not by reference.
See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/extended/multitasking.html#queues for details.

parameterdescription.para: The queue handle
A pointer to the item that will be placed on the queue.
Time to wait for space to become available. A timeout of 0 can be used to attempt to post without blocking. TIMEOUT_MAX can be used to block indefinitely.

simplesect.para: True if the item was preprended, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Receive an item from a queue without removing the item from the queue.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/extended/multitasking.html#queues for details.

parameterdescription.para: The queue handle
Pointer to a buffer to which the received item will be copied
The maximum amount of time the task should block waiting for an item to receive should the queue be empty at the time of the call. TIMEOUT_MAX can be used to block indefinitely.

simplesect.para: True if an item was copied into the buffer, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Receive an item from the queue.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/extended/multitasking.html#queues for details.

parameterdescription.para: The queue handle
Pointer to a buffer to which the received item will be copied

The maximum amount of time the task should block waiting for an item to receive should the queue be empty at the time of the call. queue_recv() will return immediately if timeout is zero and the queue is empty.

simplesect.para: True if an item was copied into the buffer, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Return the number of messages stored in a queue.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/extended/multitasking.html#queues for details.

parameterdescription.para: The queue handle.

simplesect.para: The number of messages available in the queue.

briefdescription.para: Return the number of spaces left in a queue.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/extended/multitasking.html#queues for details.

parameterdescription.para: The queue handle.

simplesect.para: The number of spaces available in the queue.

briefdescription.para: Registers a device in the given zero-indexed port.

detaileddescription.para: Registers a device of the given type in the given port into the registry, if that type of device is detected to be plugged in to that port.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (0-20), or a a different device than specified is plugged in. EADDRINUSE - The port is already registered to another device.

parameterdescription.para: The port number to register the device
The type of device to register

simplesect.para: 1 upon success, PROS_ERR upon failure

briefdescription.para: Deregisters a devices from the given zero-indexed port.

detaileddescription.para: Removes the device registed in the given port, if there is one.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (0-20).

parameterdescription.para: The port number to deregister

simplesect.para: 1 upon success, PROS_ERR upon failure

briefdescription.para: Returns the type of device registered to the zero-indexed port.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (0-20).

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 0-20

simplesect.para: The type of device that is registered into the port (NOT what is plugged in)

briefdescription.para: Returns the type of the device plugged into the zero-indexed port.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (0-20).

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 0-20

simplesect.para: The type of device that is plugged into the port (NOT what is registered)

briefdescription.para: Sets the reverse flag for the motor.

detaileddescription.para: This will invert its movements and the values returned for its position.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
True reverses the motor, false is default

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: 1 if the motor has been reversed and 0 if the motor was not reversed, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

description.para: These functions allow programmers to make motors move

briefdescription.para: Sets the voltage for the motor from -127 to 127.

detaileddescription.para: This is designed to map easily to the input from the controller's analog stick for simple opcontrol use. The actual behavior of the motor is analogous to use of motor_move_voltage(), or motorSet() from the PROS 2 API.

This function will not respect brake modes, and simply sets the voltage to the desired value.
A negative port will negate the input voltage
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors
The new motor voltage from -127 to 127

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Stops the motor using the currently configured brake mode.

detaileddescription.para: This function sets motor velocity to zero, which will cause it to act according to the set brake mode. If brake mode is set to MOTOR_BRAKE_HOLD, this function may behave differently than calling motor_move_absolute(port, 0) or motor_move_relative(port, 0).
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

memberdef.argsstring: (int8_t port, double position, const int32_t velocity)
memberdef.name: motor_move_absolute

briefdescription.para: Sets the target absolute position for the motor to move to.

detaileddescription.para: This movement is relative to the position of the motor when initialized or the position when it was most recently reset with motor_set_zero_position().

This function simply sets the target for the motor, it does not block program execution until the movement finishes. The example code shows how to block until a movement is finished.
A negative port number will negate the target position
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors
The absolute position to move to in the motor's encoder units
The maximum allowable velocity for the movement in RPM

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

memberdef.argsstring: (int8_t port, double position, const int32_t velocity)
memberdef.name: motor_move_relative

briefdescription.para: Sets the relative target position for the motor to move to.

detaileddescription.para: This movement is relative to the current position of the motor as given in motor_get_position(). Providing 10.0 as the position parameter would result in the motor moving clockwise 10 units, no matter what the current position is.

This function simply sets the target for the motor, it does not block program execution until the movement finishes. The example code shows how to block until a movement is finished.
A negative port will negate the target position
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors
The relative position to move to in the motor's encoder units
The maximum allowable velocity for the movement in RPM

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the velocity for the motor.

detaileddescription.para: This velocity corresponds to different actual speeds depending on the gearset used for the motor. This results in a range of +-100 for E_MOTOR_GEARSET_36, +-200 for E_MOTOR_GEARSET_18, and +-600 for E_MOTOR_GEARSET_6. The velocity is held with PID to ensure consistent speed, as opposed to setting the motor's voltage.

A negative port will negate the velocity
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors
The new motor velocity from +-100, +-200, or +-600 depending on the motor's gearset

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the output voltage for the motor from -12000 to 12000 in millivolts.

detaileddescription.para:
A negative port negates the voltage
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: This function will not respect brake modes, and simply sets the voltage to the desired value.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors
The new voltage value from -12000 to 12000

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Changes the output velocity for a profiled movement (motor_move_absolute or motor_move_relative).

detaileddescription.para: This will have no effect if the motor is not following a profiled movement.

A negative port negates the velocity
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors
The new motor velocity from +-100, +-200, or +-600 depending on the motor's gearset

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the target position set for the motor by the user.

detaileddescription.para:
A negative port negates the return value
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors

simplesect.para: The target position in its encoder units or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the velocity commanded to the motor by the user.

detaileddescription.para:
A negative port negates the return value
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors

simplesect.para: The commanded motor velocity from +-100, +-200, or +-600, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

description.para: These functions allow programmers to collect telemetry from motors

briefdescription.para: Gets the actual velocity of the motor.

detaileddescription.para:
A negative port negates the return value
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors

simplesect.para: The motor's actual velocity in RPM or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current drawn by the motor in mA.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors

simplesect.para: The motor's current in mA or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the direction of movement for the motor.

detaileddescription.para:
A negative port number negates the return value.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors

simplesect.para: 1 for moving in the positive direction, -1 for moving in the negative direction, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the efficiency of the motor in percent.

detaileddescription.para: An efficiency of 100% means that the motor is moving electrically while drawing no electrical power, and an efficiency of 0% means that the motor is drawing power but not moving.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors

simplesect.para: The motor's efficiency in percent or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the motor is drawing over its current limit.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors

simplesect.para: 1 if the motor's current limit is being exceeded and 0 if the current limit is not exceeded, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the motor's temperature is above its limit.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports |1-21|. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1 to 21, or from -21 to -1 for reversed motors

simplesect.para: 1 if the temperature limit is exceeded and 0 if the the temperature is below the limit, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the detected color hue.

detaileddescription.para: This is not available if gestures are being detected. Hue has a range of 0 to 359.999

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: hue value if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the detected color saturation.

detaileddescription.para: This is not available if gestures are being detected. Saturation has a range of 0 to 1.0

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: saturation value if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the detected color brightness.

detaileddescription.para: This is not available if gestures are being detected. Brightness has a range of 0 to 1.0

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: brightness value if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the detected proximity value.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: poximity value if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

memberdef.name: vision_create_color_code

briefdescription.para: Creates a color code that represents a combination of the given signature IDs.

detaileddescription.para: If fewer than 5 signatures are to be a part of the color code, pass 0 for the additional function parameters.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - Fewer than two signatures have been provided or one of the signatures is out of its [1-7] range (or 0 when omitted).

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The first signature id [1-7] to add to the color code
The second signature id [1-7] to add to the color code
The third signature id [1-7] to add to the color code
The fourth signature id [1-7] to add to the color code
The fifth signature id [1-7] to add to the color code

simplesect.para: A vision_color_code_t object containing the color code information.

briefdescription.para: Gets the nth largest object according to size_id.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EDOM - size_id is greater than the number of available objects. EHOSTDOWN - Reading the vision sensor failed for an unknown reason.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)

simplesect.para: The vision_object_s_t object corresponding to the given size id, or PROS_ERR if an error occurred.

ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EINVAL - sig_id is outside the range [1-8] EDOM - size_id is greater than the number of available objects. EAGAIN - Reading the vision sensor failed for an unknown reason.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)
The signature ID [1-7] for which an object will be returned.

simplesect.para: The vision_object_s_t object corresponding to the given signature and size_id, or PROS_ERR if an error occurred.

memberdef.name: vision_read_by_size

briefdescription.para: Reads up to object_count object descriptors into object_arr.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21), or fewer than object_count number of objects were found. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EDOM - size_id is greater than the number of available objects.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)
The number of objects to read
A pointer to copy the objects into

simplesect.para: The number of object signatures copied. This number will be less than object_count if there are fewer objects detected by the vision sensor. Returns PROS_ERR if the port was invalid, an error occurred, or fewer objects than size_id were found. All objects in object_arr that were not found are given VISION_OBJECT_ERR_SIG as their signature.

description.para: These functions allow programmers to display shapes on the v5 screen

briefdescription.para: Set the pen color for subsequent graphics operations.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCESS - Another resource is currently trying to access the screen mutex.

parameterdescription.para: The pen color to set (it is recommended to use values from the enum defined in colors.h)

simplesect.para: Returns 1 if the mutex was successfully returned, or PROS_ERR if there was an error either taking or returning the screen mutex.

memberdef.name: screen_print_at

briefdescription.para: Print a formatted string to the screen at the specified point.

detaileddescription.para: Will default to a medium sized font by default if invalid txt_fmt is given.
Text formats medium_center and large_center will default to medium and large respectively.

parameterdescription.para: Text format enum that determines if the text is small, medium, or large.
The y coordinate of the top left corner of the string
The x coordinate of the top left corner of the string
Format string
Optional list of arguments for the format string

simplesect.para: 1 if there were no errors, or PROS_ERR if an error occured taking or returning the screen mutex.

memberdef.argsstring: (text_format_e_t txt_fmt, const int16_t line, const char *text, va_list args)
memberdef.name: screen_vprintf

briefdescription.para: Print a formatted string to the screen on the specified line.

detaileddescription.para: Same as display_printf except that this uses a va_list instead of the ellipsis operator so this can be used by other functions.
Will default to a medium sized font by default if invalid txt_fmt is given. Exposed mostly for writing libraries and custom functions.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCESS - Another resource is currently trying to access the screen mutex.

parameterdescription.para: Text format enum that determines if the text is medium, large, medium_center, or large_center. (DOES NOT SUPPORT SMALL)
The line number on which to print
Format string
List of arguments for the format string

simplesect.para: 1 if there were no errors, or PROS_ERR if an error occured while taking or returning the screen mutex.

memberdef.argsstring: (text_format_e_t txt_fmt, const int16_t x, const int16_t y, const char *text, va_list args)
memberdef.name: screen_vprintf_at

briefdescription.para: Print a formatted string to the screen at the specified coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: Same as display_printf_at except that this uses a va_list instead of the ellipsis operator so this can be used by other functions.
Will default to a medium sized font by default if invalid txt_fmt is given.
Text formats medium_center and large_center will default to medium and large respectively. Exposed mostly for writing libraries and custom functions.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCESS - Another resource is currently trying to access the screen mutex.

parameterdescription.para: Text format enum that determines if the text is small, medium, or large.
The (x,y) coordinates of the top left corner of the string
Format string
List of arguments for the format string

simplesect.para: 1 if there were no errors, or PROS_ERR if an error occured while taking or returning the screen mutex.

description.para: These functions allow programmers to access information about screen touches

briefdescription.para: Gets the touch status of the last touch of the screen.

simplesect.para: The last_touch_e_t enum specifier that indicates the last touch status of the screen (E_TOUCH_EVENT_RELEASE, E_TOUCH_EVENT_PRESS, or E_TOUCH_EVENT_PRESS_AND_HOLD). This will be released by default if no action was taken. If an error occured, the screen_touch_status_s_t will have its last_touch_e_t enum specifier set to E_TOUCH_ERR, and other values set to -1.

briefdescription.para: Assigns a callback function to be called when a certain touch event happens.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EACCESS - Another resource is currently trying to access the screen mutex.

parameterdescription.para: Function pointer to callback when event type happens
Touch event that will trigger the callback.

simplesect.para: 1 if there were no errors, or PROS_ERR if an error occured while taking or returning the screen mutex.

description.para: These functions allow programmers to communicate using UART over RS485

briefdescription.para: Enables generic serial on the given port.

detaileddescription.para:
This function must be called before any of the generic serial functions will work.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the baudrate for the serial port to operate at.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The baudrate to operate at

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Clears the internal input and output FIFO buffers.

detaileddescription.para: This can be useful to reset state and remove old, potentially unneeded data from the input FIFO buffer or to cancel sending any data in the output FIFO buffer.

This function does not cause the data in the output buffer to be written, it simply clears the internal buffers. Unlike stdout, generic serial does not use buffered IO (the FIFO buffers are written as soon as possible).
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of bytes available to be read in the the port's FIFO input buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
This function does not actually read any bytes, is simply returns the number of bytes available to be read.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: The number of bytes avaliable to be read or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of bytes free in the port's FIFO output buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
This function does not actually write any bytes, is simply returns the number of bytes free in the port's buffer.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: The number of bytes free or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Reads the next byte avaliable in the port's input buffer without removing it.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: The next byte avaliable to be read, -1 if none are available, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Reads the next byte avaliable in the port's input buffer.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: The next byte avaliable to be read, -1 if none are available, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Reads up to the next length bytes from the port's input buffer and places them in the user supplied buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
This function will only return bytes that are currently avaliable to be read and will not block waiting for any to arrive.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The location to place the data read
The maximum number of bytes to read

simplesect.para: The number of bytes read or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Write the given byte to the port's output buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
Data in the port's output buffer is written to the serial port as soon as possible on a FIFO basis and can not be done manually by the user.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port. EIO - Serious internal write error.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The byte to write

simplesect.para: The number of bytes written or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Writes up to length bytes from the user supplied buffer to the port's output buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
Data in the port's output buffer is written to the serial port as soon as possible on a FIFO basis and can not be done manually by the user.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the port. EIO - Serious internal write error.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 port number from 1-21
The data to write
The maximum number of bytes to write

simplesect.para: The number of bytes written or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Calibrates the analog sensor on the specified port and returns the new calibration value.

detaileddescription.para: This method assumes that the true sensor value is not actively changing at this time and computes an average from approximately 500 samples, 1 ms apart, for a 0.5 s period of calibration. The average value thus calculated is returned and stored for later calls to the adi_analog_read_calibrated() and adi_analog_read_calibrated_HR() functions. These functions will return the difference between this value and the current sensor value when called.
Do not use this function when the sensor value might be unstable (gyro rotation, accelerometer movement).

The ADI currently returns data at 10ms intervals, in constrast to the calibrate functions 1ms sample rate. This sample rate was kept for the sake of being similar to PROS 2, and increasing the sample rate would not have a tangible difference in the functions performance.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of ADI Ports

parameterdescription.para: The ADI port to calibrate (from 1-8, 'a'-'h', 'A'-'H')

simplesect.para: The average sensor value computed by this function

briefdescription.para: Gets the 12-bit value of the specified port.

detaileddescription.para: The value returned is undefined if the analog pin has been switched to a different mode.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of ADI Ports EADDRINUSE - The port is not configured as an analog input

parameterdescription.para: The ADI port (from 1-8, 'a'-'h', 'A'-'H') for which the value will be returned

simplesect.para: The analog sensor value, where a value of 0 reflects an input voltage of nearly 0 V and a value of 4095 reflects an input voltage of nearly 5 V

briefdescription.para: Gets the 12 bit calibrated value of an analog input port.

detaileddescription.para: The adi_analog_calibrate() function must be run first. This function is inappropriate for sensor values intended for integration, as round-off error can accumulate causing drift over time. Use adi_analog_read_calibrated_HR() instead.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of ADI Ports EADDRINUSE - The port is not configured as an analog input

parameterdescription.para: The ADI port (from 1-8, 'a'-'h', 'A'-'H') for which the value will be returned

simplesect.para: The difference of the sensor value from its calibrated default from -4095 to 4095

briefdescription.para: Gets the 16 bit calibrated value of an analog input port.

detaileddescription.para: The adi_analog_calibrate() function must be run first. This is intended for integrated sensor values such as gyros and accelerometers to reduce drift due to round-off, and should not be used on a sensor such as a line tracker or potentiometer.

The value returned actually has 16 bits of "precision", even though the ADC only reads 12 bits, so that error induced by the average value being between two values when integrated over time is trivial. Think of the value as the true value times 16.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of ADI Ports EADDRINUSE - The port is not configured as an analog input

parameterdescription.para: The ADI port (from 1-8, 'a'-'h', 'A'-'H') for which the value will be returned

simplesect.para: The difference of the sensor value from its calibrated default from -16384 to 16384

briefdescription.para: Gets the digital value (1 or 0) of a port configured as a digital input.

detaileddescription.para: If the port is configured as some other mode, the digital value which reflects the current state of the port is returned, which may or may not differ from the currently set value. The return value is undefined for ports configured as any mode other than a Digital Input.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of ADI Ports EADDRINUSE - The port is not configured as a digital input

parameterdescription.para: The ADI port to read (from 1-8, 'a'-'h', 'A'-'H')

simplesect.para: True if the pin is HIGH, or false if it is LOW

briefdescription.para: Gets a rising-edge case for a digital button press.

detaileddescription.para: This function is not thread-safe. Multiple tasks polling a single button may return different results under the same circumstances, so only one task should call this function for any given button. E.g., Task A calls this function for buttons 1 and 2. Task B may call this function for button 3, but should not for buttons 1 or 2. A typical use-case for this function is to call inside opcontrol to detect new button presses, and not in any other tasks.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of ADI Ports EADDRINUSE - The port is not configured as a digital input

parameterdescription.para: The ADI port to read (from 1-8, 'a'-'h', 'A'-'H')

simplesect.para: 1 if the button is pressed and had not been pressed the last time this function was called, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the digital value (1 or 0) of a port configured as a digital output.

detaileddescription.para: If the port is configured as some other mode, behavior is undefined.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of ADI Ports EADDRINUSE - The port is not configured as a digital output

parameterdescription.para: The ADI port to read (from 1-8, 'a'-'h', 'A'-'H')
An expression evaluating to "true" or "false" to set the output to HIGH or LOW respectively, or the constants HIGH or LOW themselves

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current gyro angle in tenths of a degree.

detaileddescription.para: Unless a multiplier is applied to the gyro, the return value will be a whole number representing the number of degrees of rotation times 10.
There are 360 degrees in a circle, thus the gyro will return 3600 for one whole rotation.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of ADI Ports EADDRINUSE - The port is not configured as a gyro

parameterdescription.para: The adi_gyro_t object for which the angle will be returned

simplesect.para: The gyro angle in degrees.

briefdescription.para: Initializes a gyroscope on the given port.

detaileddescription.para: If the given port has not previously been configured as a gyro, then this function starts a 1300 ms calibration period.
It is highly recommended that this function be called from initialize() when the robot is stationary to ensure proper calibration.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of ADI Ports EADDRINUSE - The port is not configured as a gyro

A scalar value that will be multiplied by the gyro heading value supplied by the ADI

simplesect.para: An adi_gyro_t object containing the given port, or PROS_ERR if the initialization failed.

briefdescription.para: Get the currently measured distance from the sensor in mm.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Distance Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Distance Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: The distance value or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the confidence in the distance reading.

detaileddescription.para: This is a value that has a range of 0 to 63. 63 means high confidence, lower values imply less confidence. Confidence is only available when distance is > 200mm (the value 10 is returned in this scenario).

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Distance Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Distance Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: The confidence value or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the current guess at relative object size.

detaileddescription.para: This is a value that has a range of 0 to 400. A 18" x 30" grey card will return a value of approximately 75 in typical room lighting.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Distance Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Distance Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: The size value or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the object velocity in m/s.

simplesect.para: The velocity value or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - Either the ADI port value or the smart port value is not within its valid range (ADI port: 1-8, 'a'-'h', or 'A'-'H'; smart port: 1-21).

briefdescription.para: Calibrates the analog sensor on the specified port and returns the new calibration value.

detaileddescription.para: This method assumes that the true sensor value is not actively changing at this time and computes an average from approximately 500 samples, 1 ms apart, for a 0.5 s period of calibration. The average value thus calculated is returned and stored for later calls to the adi_analog_read_calibrated() and adi_analog_read_calibrated_HR() functions. These functions will return the difference between this value and the current sensor value when called.
Do not use this function when the sensor value might be unstable (gyro rotation, accelerometer movement).

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - Either the ADI port value or the smart port value is not within its valid range (ADI port: 1-8, 'a'-'h', or 'A'-'H'; smart port: 1-21).

parameterdescription.para: The smart port number that the ADI Expander is in
The ADI port to calibrate (from 1-8, 'a'-'h', 'A'-'H')

simplesect.para: The average sensor value computed by this function

briefdescription.para: Gets the 12-bit value of the specified port.

detaileddescription.para: The value returned is undefined if the analog pin has been switched to a different mode.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - Either the ADI port value or the smart port value is not within its valid range (ADI port: 1-8, 'a'-'h', or 'A'-'H'; smart port: 1-21). EADDRINUSE - The port is not configured as an analog input

parameterdescription.para: The smart port number that the ADI Expander is in
The ADI port (from 1-8, 'a'-'h', 'A'-'H') for which the value will be returned

simplesect.para: The analog sensor value, where a value of 0 reflects an input voltage of nearly 0 V and a value of 4095 reflects an input voltage of nearly 5 V

briefdescription.para: Gets the 12 bit calibrated value of an analog input port.

detaileddescription.para: The adi_analog_calibrate() function must be run first. This function is inappropriate for sensor values intended for integration, as round-off error can accumulate causing drift over time. Use adi_analog_read_calibrated_HR() instead.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - Either the ADI port value or the smart port value is not within its valid range (ADI port: 1-8, 'a'-'h', or 'A'-'H'; smart port: 1-21). EADDRINUSE - The port is not configured as an analog input

parameterdescription.para: The smart port number that the ADI Expander is in
The ADI port (from 1-8, 'a'-'h', 'A'-'H') for which the value will be returned

simplesect.para: The difference of the sensor value from its calibrated default from -4095 to 4095

briefdescription.para: Gets the 16 bit calibrated value of an analog input port.

detaileddescription.para: The adi_analog_calibrate() function must be run first. This is intended for integrated sensor values such as gyros and accelerometers to reduce drift due to round-off, and should not be used on a sensor such as a line tracker or potentiometer.

The value returned actually has 16 bits of "precision", even though the ADC only reads 12 bits, so that error induced by the average value being between two values when integrated over time is trivial. Think of the value as the true value times 16.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - Either the ADI port value or the smart port value is not within its valid range (ADI port: 1-8, 'a'-'h', or 'A'-'H'; smart port: 1-21). EADDRINUSE - The port is not configured as an analog input

parameterdescription.para: The smart port number that the ADI Expander is in
The ADI port (from 1-8, 'a'-'h', 'A'-'H') for which the value will be returned

simplesect.para: The difference of the sensor value from its calibrated default from -16384 to 16384

briefdescription.para: Gets the digital value (1 or 0) of a port configured as a digital input.

detaileddescription.para: If the port is configured as some other mode, the digital value which reflects the current state of the port is returned, which may or may not differ from the currently set value. The return value is undefined for ports configured as any mode other than a Digital Input.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - Either the ADI port value or the smart port value is not within its valid range (ADI port: 1-8, 'a'-'h', or 'A'-'H'; smart port: 1-21). EADDRINUSE - The port is not configured as a digital input

parameterdescription.para: The smart port number that the ADI Expander is in
The ADI port to read (from 1-8, 'a'-'h', 'A'-'H')

simplesect.para: True if the pin is HIGH, or false if it is LOW

briefdescription.para: Gets a rising-edge case for a digital button press.

detaileddescription.para: This function is not thread-safe. Multiple tasks polling a single button may return different results under the same circumstances, so only one task should call this function for any given button. E.g., Task A calls this function for buttons 1 and 2. Task B may call this function for button 3, but should not for buttons 1 or 2. A typical use-case for this function is to call inside opcontrol to detect new button presses, and not in any other tasks.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - Either the ADI port value or the smart port value is not within its valid range (ADI port: 1-8, 'a'-'h', or 'A'-'H'; smart port: 1-21). EADDRINUSE - The port is not configured as a digital input

parameterdescription.para: The smart port number that the ADI Expander is in
The ADI port to read (from 1-8, 'a'-'h', 'A'-'H')

simplesect.para: 1 if the button is pressed and had not been pressed the last time this function was called, 0 otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: If the port is configured as some other mode, behavior is undefined.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current gyro angle in tenths of a degree.

detaileddescription.para: Unless a multiplier is applied to the gyro, the return value will be a whole number representing the number of degrees of rotation times 10.

It is highly recommended that this function be called from initialize() when the robot is stationary to ensure proper calibration.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of ADI Ports EINVAL - A given value is not correct, or the buffer is null EADDRINUSE - The port is not configured for ADI output

parameterdescription.para: port of type adi_led_t
array of colors in format 0xRRGGBB, recommended that individual RGB value not to exceed 0x80 due to current draw
length of the input buffer
position of the pixel to clear (0 indexed)

simplesect.para: PROS_SUCCESS if successful, PROS_ERR if not

briefdescription.para: Set the GPS's offset relative to the center of turning in meters, as well as its initial position.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a GPS EAGAIN - The sensor is still calibrating

parameterdescription.para: The V5 GPS port number from 1-21
Cartesian 4-Quadrant X offset from center of turning (meters)
Cartesian 4-Quadrant Y offset from center of turning (meters)
Initial 4-Quadrant X Position, with (0,0) being at the center of the field (meters)
Initial 4-Quadrant Y Position, with (0,0) being at the center of the field (meters)
Heading with 0 being north on the field, in degrees [0,360) going clockwise

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Calibrate IMU.

detaileddescription.para: Calibration takes approximately 2 seconds, but this function only blocks until the IMU status flag is set properly to E_IMU_STATUS_CALIBRATING, with a minimum blocking time of 5ms.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Inertial Sensor EAGAIN - The sensor is already calibrating, or time out setting the status flag.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Inertial Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Calibrate IMU and Blocks while Calibrating.

detaileddescription.para: Calibration takes approximately 2 seconds and blocks during this period, with a timeout for this operation being set a 3 seconds as a safety margin. Like the other reset function, this function also blocks until the IMU status flag is set properly to E_IMU_STATUS_CALIBRATING, with a minimum blocking time of 5ms and a timeout of 1 second if it's never set.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Inertial Sensor EAGAIN - The sensor is already calibrating, or time out setting the status flag.

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Inertial Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed (timing out or port claim failure), setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Set the Inertial Sensor's refresh interval in milliseconds.

detaileddescription.para: The rate may be specified in increments of 5ms, and will be rounded down to the nearest increment. The minimum allowable refresh rate is 5ms. The default rate is 10ms.

As values are copied into the shared memory buffer only at 10ms intervals, setting this value to less than 10ms does not mean that you can poll the sensor's values any faster. However, it will guarantee that the data is as recent as possible.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Inertial Sensor EAGAIN - The sensor is still calibrating

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Inertial Sensor port number from 1-21
The data refresh interval in milliseconds

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the total number of degrees the Inertial Sensor has spun about the z-axis.

detaileddescription.para: This value is theoretically unbounded. Clockwise rotations are represented with positive degree values, while counterclockwise rotations are represented with negative ones.

briefdescription.para: Initializes a link on a radio port, with an indicated type.

detaileddescription.para: There might be a 1 to 2 second delay from when this function is called to when the link is initializes. PROS currently only supports the use of one radio per brain.

simplesect.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a radio. ENXIO - The sensor is still calibrating, or no link is connected via the radio.

parameterdescription.para: The port of the radio for the intended link.
Unique link ID in the form of a string, needs to be different from other links in the area.
Indicates whether the radio link on the brain is a transmitter or reciever, with the transmitter having double the transmitting bandwidth as the recieving end (1040 bytes/s vs 520 bytes/s).

simplesect.para: PROS_ERR if initialization fails, 1 if the initialization succeeds.

briefdescription.para: Initializes a link on a radio port, with an indicated type and the ability for vexlink to override the controller radio.

detaileddescription.para: There might be a 1 to 2 second delay from when this function is called to when the link is initializes. PROS currently only supports the use of one radio per brain.

simplesect.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a radio. ENXIO - The sensor is still calibrating, or no link is connected via the radio.

parameterdescription.para: The port of the radio for the intended link.
Unique link ID in the form of a string, needs to be different from other links in the area.
Indicates whether the radio link on the brain is a transmitter or reciever, with the transmitter having double the transmitting bandwidth as the recieving end (1040 bytes/s vs 520 bytes/s).

simplesect.para: PROS_ERR if initialization fails, 1 if the initialization succeeds.

simplesect.para: If a radio is connected to a port and it's connected to a link.

briefdescription.para: Send raw serial data through vexlink.

simplesect.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a radio. ENXIO - The sensor is still calibrating, or no link is connected via the radio. EBUSY - The transmitter buffer is still busy with a previous transmission, and there is no room in the FIFO buffer (queue) to transmit the data. EINVAL - The data given is NULL

parameterdescription.para: The port of the radio for the intended link.
Buffer with data to send
Bytes of data to be read to the destination buffer

simplesect.para: PROS_ERR if port is not a link, and the successfully transmitted data size if it succeeded.

briefdescription.para: Receive raw serial data through vexlink.

simplesect.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a radio. ENXIO - The sensor is still calibrating, or no link is connected via the radio. EINVAL - The destination given is NULL, or the size given is larger than the FIFO buffer or destination buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The port of the radio for the intended link.
Destination buffer to read data to
Bytes of data to be read to the destination buffer

simplesect.para: PROS_ERR if port is not a link, and the successfully received data size if it succeeded.

briefdescription.para: Send packeted message through vexlink, with a checksum and start byte.

simplesect.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a radio. ENXIO - The sensor is still calibrating, or no link is connected via the radio. EBUSY - The transmitter buffer is still busy with a previous transmission, and there is no room in the FIFO buffer (queue) to transmit the data. EINVAL - The data given is NULL

parameterdescription.para: The port of the radio for the intended link.
Buffer with data to send
Bytes of data to be read to the destination buffer

simplesect.para: PROS_ERR if port is not a link, and the successfully transmitted data size if it succeeded.

briefdescription.para: Receive packeted message through vexlink, with a checksum and start byte.

simplesect.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a radio. ENXIO - The sensor is still calibrating, or no link is connected via the radio. EINVAL - The destination given is NULL, or the size given is larger than the FIFO buffer or destination buffer. EBADMSG - Protocol error related to start byte, data size, or checksum.

parameterdescription.para: The port of the radio for the intended link.
Destination buffer to read data to
Bytes of data to be read to the destination buffer

simplesect.para: PROS_ERR if port is not a link or protocol error, and the successfully transmitted data size if it succeeded.

briefdescription.para: Clear the receive buffer of the link, and discarding the data.

briefdescription.para: Displays a formatted string on the emulated three-button LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first. EINVAL - The line number specified is not in the range [0-7]

parameterdescription.para: The line on which to display the text [0-7]
Format string
Optional list of arguments for the format string

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current status of the competition control.

simplesect.para: The competition control status as a mask of bits with COMPETITION_{ENABLED,AUTONOMOUS,CONNECTED}.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the controller is connected.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of CONTROLLER_MASTER or CONTROLLER_PARTNER

simplesect.para: 1 if the controller is connected, 0 otherwise

briefdescription.para: Gets the value of an analog channel (joystick) on a controller.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of CONTROLLER_MASTER or CONTROLLER_PARTNER
The analog channel to get. Must be one of ANALOG_LEFT_X, ANALOG_LEFT_Y, ANALOG_RIGHT_X, ANALOG_RIGHT_Y

simplesect.para: The current reading of the analog channel: [-127, 127]. If the controller was not connected, then 0 is returned

briefdescription.para: Gets the battery capacity of the given controller.

briefdescription.para: Checks if a digital channel (button) on the controller is currently pressed.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of CONTROLLER_MASTER or CONTROLLER_PARTNER
The button to read. Must be one of DIGITAL_{RIGHT,DOWN,LEFT,UP,A,B,Y,X,R1,R2,L1,L2}

simplesect.para: 1 if the button on the controller is pressed. If the controller was not connected, then 0 is returned

briefdescription.para: Returns a rising-edge case for a controller button press.

detaileddescription.para: This function is not thread-safe. Multiple tasks polling a single button may return different results under the same circumstances, so only one task should call this function for any given button. E.g., Task A calls this function for buttons 1 and 2. Task B may call this function for button 3, but should not for buttons 1 or 2. A typical use-case for this function is to call inside opcontrol to detect new button presses, and not in any other tasks.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of CONTROLLER_MASTER or CONTROLLER_PARTNER
The button to read. Must be one of DIGITAL_{RIGHT,DOWN,LEFT,UP,A,B,Y,X,R1,R2,L1,L2}

simplesect.para: 1 if the button on the controller is pressed and had not been pressed the last time this function was called, 0 otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (controller_id_e_t id, uint8_t line, uint8_t col, const char *fmt,...)
memberdef.name: controller_print

briefdescription.para: Sets text to the controller LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para:
Controller text setting is a slow process, so updates faster than 10ms when on a wired connection or 50ms over Vexnet will not be applied to the controller.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - A value other than E_CONTROLLER_MASTER or E_CONTROLLER_PARTNER is given. EACCES - Another resource is currently trying to access the controller port. EAGAIN - Could not send the text to the controller.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the controller (e.g. the master or partner controller). Must be one of CONTROLLER_MASTER or CONTROLLER_PARTNER
The line number at which the text will be displayed [0-2]
The column number at which the text will be displayed [0-14]
The format string to print to the controller
The argument list for the format string

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

memberdef.argsstring: (controller_id_e_t id, uint8_t line, uint8_t col, const char *str)

Controller rumble activation is a slow process, so updates faster than 10ms when on a wired connection or 50ms over Vexnet will not be applied to the controller.

memberdef.argsstring: (task_fn_t function, void *const parameters, uint32_t prio, const uint16_t stack_depth, const char *const name)
memberdef.name: task_create

briefdescription.para: Creates a new task and add it to the list of tasks that are ready to run.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENOMEM - The stack cannot be used as the TCB was not created.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the task entry function

Pointer to memory that will be used as a parameter for the task being created. This memory should not typically come from stack, but rather from dynamically (i.e., malloc'd) or statically allocated memory.
The priority at which the task should run. TASK_PRIO_DEFAULT plus/minus 1 or 2 is typically used.
The number of words (i.e. 4 * stack_depth) available on the task's stack. TASK_STACK_DEPTH_DEFAULT is typically sufficienct.
A descriptive name for the task. This is mainly used to facilitate debugging. The name may be up to 32 characters long.

simplesect.para: A handle by which the newly created task can be referenced. If an error occurred, NULL will be returned and errno can be checked for hints as to why task_create failed.

briefdescription.para: Removes a task from the RTOS real time kernel's management.

detaileddescription.para: The task being deleted will be removed from all ready, blocked, suspended and event lists.
Memory dynamically allocated by the task is not automatically freed, and should be freed before the task is deleted.

parameterdescription.para: The handle of the task to be deleted. Passing NULL will cause the calling task to be deleted.

briefdescription.para: Delays the current task for a given number of milliseconds.

detaileddescription.para: This is not the best method to have a task execute code at predefined intervals, as the delay time is measured from when the delay is requested. To delay cyclically, use task_delay_until().

parameterdescription.para: The number of milliseconds to wait (1000 milliseconds per second)

briefdescription.para: Delays the current task for a given number of milliseconds.

detaileddescription.para: This is not the best method to have a task execute code at predefined intervals, as the delay time is measured from when the delay is requested. To delay cyclically, use task_delay_until().

parameterdescription.para: The number of milliseconds to wait (1000 milliseconds per second)

briefdescription.para: Delays the current task until a specified time.

detaileddescription.para: This function can be used by periodic tasks to ensure a constant execution frequency.
The task will be woken up at the time *prev_time + delta, and *prev_time will be updated to reflect the time at which the task will unblock.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the location storing the setpoint time. This should typically be initialized to the return value of millis().
The number of milliseconds to wait (1000 milliseconds per second)

briefdescription.para: Gets the priority of the specified task.

parameterdescription.para: The task to check

simplesect.para: The priority of the task

briefdescription.para: Sets the priority of the specified task.

detaileddescription.para: If the specified task's state is available to be scheduled (e.g. not blocked) and new priority is higher than the currently running task, a context switch may occur.

parameterdescription.para: The task to set
The new priority of the task

briefdescription.para: Gets the state of the specified task.

parameterdescription.para: The task to check

simplesect.para: The state of the task

briefdescription.para: Suspends the specified task, making it ineligible to be scheduled.

parameterdescription.para: The task to suspend

briefdescription.para: Resumes the specified task, making it eligible to be scheduled.

parameterdescription.para: The task to resume

briefdescription.para: Gets the number of tasks the kernel is currently managing, including all ready, blocked, or suspended tasks.

detaileddescription.para: A task that has been deleted, but not yet reaped by the idle task will also be included in the count. Tasks recently created may take one context switch to be counted.

simplesect.para: The number of tasks that are currently being managed by the kernel.

briefdescription.para: Gets the name of the specified task.

parameterdescription.para: The task to check

simplesect.para: A pointer to the name of the task

briefdescription.para: Gets a task handle from the specified name.

detaileddescription.para: The operation takes a relatively long time and should be used sparingly.

parameterdescription.para: The name to query

simplesect.para: A task handle with a matching name, or NULL if none were found.

briefdescription.para: Get the currently running task handle.

detaileddescription.para: This could be useful if a task wants to tell another task about itself.

simplesect.para: The currently running task handle.

briefdescription.para: Sends a simple notification to task and increments the notification counter.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/notifications.html for details.

parameterdescription.para: The task to notify

simplesect.para: Always returns true.

briefdescription.para: Utilizes task notifications to wait until specified task is complete and deleted, then continues to execute the program.

detaileddescription.para: Analogous to std::thread::join in C++.
See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/notifications.html for details.

parameterdescription.para: The handle of the task to wait on.

simplesect.para: void

memberdef.argsstring: (task_t task, uint32_t value, notify_action_e_t action, uint32_t *prev_value)
memberdef.name: task_notify_ext

briefdescription.para: Sends a notification to a task, optionally performing some action.

detaileddescription.para: Will also retrieve the value of the notification in the target task before modifying the notification value.
See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/notifications.html for details.

parameterdescription.para: The task to notify
The value used in performing the action
An action to optionally perform on the receiving task's notification value
A pointer to store the previous value of the target task's notification, may be NULL

simplesect.para: Dependent on the notification action. For NOTIFY_ACTION_NO_WRITE: return 0 if the value could be written without needing to overwrite, 1 otherwise. For all other NOTIFY_ACTION values: always return 0

briefdescription.para: Waits for a notification to be nonzero.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/notifications.html for details.

parameterdescription.para: If true (1), then the notification value is cleared. If false (0), then the notification value is decremented.
Specifies the amount of time to be spent waiting for a notification to occur.

simplesect.para: The value of the task's notification value before it is decremented or cleared

briefdescription.para: Clears the notification for a task.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/notifications.html for details.

parameterdescription.para: The task to clear

simplesect.para: False if there was not a notification waiting, true if there was

briefdescription.para: Creates a mutex.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/multitasking.html#mutexes for details.

simplesect.para: A handle to a newly created mutex. If an error occurred, NULL will be returned and errno can be checked for hints as to why mutex_create failed.

briefdescription.para: Takes and locks a mutex, waiting for up to a certain number of milliseconds before timing out.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/multitasking.html#mutexes for details.

parameterdescription.para: Mutex to attempt to lock.
Time to wait before the mutex becomes available. A timeout of 0 can be used to poll the mutex. TIMEOUT_MAX can be used to block indefinitely.

simplesect.para: True if the mutex was successfully taken, false otherwise. If false is returned, then errno is set with a hint about why the the mutex couldn't be taken.

briefdescription.para: Unlocks a mutex.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/multitasking.html#mutexes for details.

parameterdescription.para: Mutex to unlock.

simplesect.para: True if the mutex was successfully returned, false otherwise. If false is returned, then errno is set with a hint about why the mutex couldn't be returned.

briefdescription.para: Deletes a mutex.

parameterdescription.para: Mutex to unlock.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the emulated three-button LCD has already been initialized.

simplesect.para: True if the LCD has been initialized or false if not.

briefdescription.para: Creates an emulation of the three-button, UART-based VEX LCD on the display.

simplesect.para: True if the LCD was successfully initialized, or false if it has already been initialized.

briefdescription.para: Turns off the Legacy LCD Emulator.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this function will clear the entire display, and you will not be able to call any further LLEMU functions until another call to lcd_initialize.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first.

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Displays a formatted string on the emulated three-button LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first. EINVAL - The line number specified is not in the range [0-7]

parameterdescription.para: The line on which to display the text [0-7]
Format string
Optional list of arguments for the format string

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Displays a string on the emulated three-button LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first. EINVAL - The line number specified is not in the range [0-7]

parameterdescription.para: The line on which to display the text [0-7]
The text to display

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Clears the contents of a line of the emulated three-button LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first. EINVAL - The line number specified is not in the range [0-7]

parameterdescription.para: The line to clear

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Registers a callback function for the leftmost button.

detaileddescription.para: When the leftmost button on the emulated three-button LCD is pressed, the user-provided callback function will be invoked.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first.

parameterdescription.para: A callback function of type lcd_btn_cb_fn_t (void (*cb)(void))

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Registers a callback function for the center button.

detaileddescription.para: When the center button on the emulated three-button LCD is pressed, the user-provided callback function will be invoked.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first.

parameterdescription.para: A callback function of type lcd_btn_cb_fn_t (void (*cb)(void))

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Registers a callback function for the rightmost button.

detaileddescription.para: When the rightmost button on the emulated three-button LCD is pressed, the user-provided callback function will be invoked.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first.

parameterdescription.para: A callback function of type lcd_btn_cb_fn_t (void (*cb)(void))

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Gets the button status from the emulated three-button LCD.

detaileddescription.para: The value returned is a 3-bit integer where 1 0 0 indicates the left button is pressed, 0 1 0 indicates the center button is pressed, and 0 0 1 indicates the right button is pressed. 0 is returned if no buttons are currently being pressed.
Note that this function is provided for legacy API compatibility purposes, with the caveat that the V5 touch screen does not actually support pressing multiple points on the screen at the same time.

simplesect.para: The buttons pressed as a bit mask

briefdescription.para: Changes the alignment of text on the LCD background.

parameterdescription.para: An enum specifying the alignment. Available alignments are: TEXT_ALIGN_LEFT TEXT_ALIGN_RIGHT TEXT_ALIGN_CENTER
